title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 302-1.1 - Practice before board
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 302-1.1 - Practice before board

State Regulations
(a) No
person except an attorney-at-law of this State, a law school graduate or senior
law student as permitted by the Judiciary Law and these rules, a representative
licensed by the board, an authorized employee of a licensed representative of
self-insurers, or a regular employee of a self-insured employer or insurance
carrier may practice before the board. (b) No officer, director, trustee or employee
of a group self-insurer, as defined in subdivision 3-a of section
50
of
the Workers' Compensation Law, may represent or participate, directly or
indirectly, on behalf of an injured worker or his dependents in any workers'
compensation proceeding in which the group or any member of the group is a
party. (c) The board shall be
deemed to include any bureau, office, unit, section, or employee, as well as
the referees of the board. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
302-1.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
